skill.name: auth
skill.description: Modern authentication and security patterns for web applications. Expert in JWT tokens, OAuth2 flows, session management, RBAC, MFA, API security, and zero-trust architectures. Framework-agnostic patterns that work with any tech stack.
skill.summary: Modern authentication and security patterns for web applications. Expert in JWT tokens, OAuth2 flows...
skill.author: Azeem-2

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing security pattern examples. No executable code. Network calls are to legitimate OAuth providers (Google, GitHub). Environment variable access is for JWT secret configuration. No dangerous patterns detected.

content.value_statement: Building secure authentication requires understanding JWT tokens, OAuth2 flows, and access control patterns. This skill provides production-ready implementations for authentication, authorization, MFA, and zero-trust security that work with any framework.
actual_capabilities: Implement JWT token management with access and refresh tokens
Configure OAuth2 providers for Google and GitHub social login
Build role-based access control (RBAC) systems with permission decorators
Add TOTP-based multi-factor authentication with QR code setup
Create security middleware with rate limiting and audit logging
Apply zero-trust validation for device, network, and behavior
limitations: This skill provides code patterns and examples, not a complete authentication system
Integration with specific databases or identity providers requires additional code
Production deployment requires proper secret management and infrastructure setup

output_examples.input: Show me how to implement JWT authentication with refresh tokens
output: Access tokens expire in 15 minutes for security
Refresh tokens last 7 days and are device-bound
Tokens use HS256 algorithm with cryptographically secure secrets
Refresh token hashes are stored for revocation support
Token type validation prevents token confusion attacks

best_practices: Use short-lived access tokens (15 minutes) with refresh token rotation
Store only hashed tokens in databases to prevent token theft
Implement rate limiting on all authentication endpoints
Enable MFA for privileged accounts and offer it to all users
anti_patterns: Storing tokens in localStorage without CSRF protection
Using the same secret key across all environments
Not validating token type or issuer in JWT verification
Implementing custom crypto instead of standard libraries

faq.question: Which frameworks are supported?
faq.answer: Patterns work with any Python framework including FastAPI, Flask, Django, and Starlette.

faq.question: What token expiry times are recommended?
faq.answer: Access tokens: 15 minutes. Refresh tokens: 7 days with rotation on each use.

faq.question: How do I integrate with my database?
faq.answer: The patterns are database-agnostic. Replace the token storage placeholders with your database calls.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only provides patterns. No data is collected, stored, or transmitted externally.

faq.question: Why are my tokens being rejected?
faq.answer: Check clock synchronization between servers, verify the secret key matches, and ensure tokens are not expired.

faq.question: How does this compare to Auth0 or Firebase?
faq.answer: This skill helps you build custom auth. Use managed services like Auth0 for faster setup with less control.
